title: Another Sion Nerf????
body:
Look, we get that riot hates bringing mana users in the top lane but really?

Sion's E is his most reliable laneing ability. I know it's not as flashy or thematic as  smashing someone in the face with a well timed axe, or his iconic shield ability. But as far as abilities go, and as far as facing a human opponent goes, none of those two abilities are particularly reliable, especially in the top lane no matter how low their costs are.

His Q can be side stepped  or even interrupted and -then- side stepped when he gets it back. His W can be bursted quite quickly before it can be detonated (especially by Riven, and before you say anything like "but then she just wasted her combo" no. Riven just wasted Sion's combo by bursting his shield and dodging his Q, and in the end riven wins out by not needing mana for that trade.)

His hilarious minion shout poke was the reliable bread and butter to his laneing phase. It's not like it's skilless either, it requires precise positioning and a landed skill shot. When he was released he could do this move all day because the cost was so low, so it was understandably nerfed by increasing its mana cost by a flat amount. Ok, Ok, I get it. I'll just be aware of my mana pool and use it sparingly, still gonna level it up first though.

Now you make it the most expensive spell in his repertoire if you choose to level it up?? Seriously?

If you want me to stop using his E to poke, then make his other abilities look more appealing, and I don't mean lowering the mana costs by a measly ten.

And if your whole stance these days is about making abilities and champions have a niche so that they are situationally good and not constantly good, what about match ups against Gnars or Nidalee's? That E on Sion was downright necessary so that he isn't destroyed in lane.

Please reconsider.

replies.body:
As a Sion top main, I guess I'm still okay with the mana costs. I mean, they already "kind of" lowered his QW mana cost to compensate just a little, while his E will still do good burst damage which comes with a well-priced mana (35/40/45/50/55).

Guess I'll always start with {{item:2041}} every game then lol.
a flat 5 mana does not compensate for a twenty mana increase.
How do you expect me to Sion support now?

The combo still exists

which is press e, tag the enemy, then set up your Q

because they are slowed they can't just walk out of it.

and if they use a dash/flash to get out, then your jungler gets to walk in and kill them because they burned their escape.
While the combo exists of course, his poke no longer exists. And laneing is always a matter of farming while poking your opponent down. If you EQ every time you'll run out of mana fast.
Tanks can't be viable, silly community. Tanks don't make the $$$$.

Let's do some maths first.

Sion got a 5 mana discount on 2 spells, make that a 10.

Sion got an increase in his **leveled up** E.

So it is considered a nerf when you upgrade your E spell for the fourth time.

I play Sion regularly and i am quite happy with these changes. Lategame your mana is nearly irrelevant, and in the laning i guess you can live with only 3 levels on E.

I usually max my W though, so it's just better for me.

If you want to have a good laning phase with Sion, allow me to shed some light on something:

**Currently Sion can easily survive and outpoke anyone in 1v1 situations, and after the laning phase, he just gets stronger and stronger mostly because of the hp stacking, the cc and the roaming possibilities.**

Riot had to tone down a bit on his laning without a doubt. I love Sion, but i love balance too.
I was overjoyed by this news because it means when I lane against a Sion he can't just pelt me with my minions all day.

Sion's probably the only champion in league who gives you advice on fighting him.
